intro: Aiouea farinosa, commonly known as the waxy hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Pacific. It is characterized by its smooth, waxy leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 6 meters. It thrives in humid, well-drained soils and is often found in coastal and lowland areas. Aiouea farinosa is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes used in traditional medicine.
